isis.stitle: T 444E Diesel Engine Diagnostics (NAVPAK) (1997) - SECTION 3.5: ELECTRONIC CONTROL SYSTEM DIAGNOSTICS, ACCELERATOR PEDAL POSITION SENSOR/IVS SWITCH (APS/IVS) - ENGINE COOLANT LEVEL SYSTEM - PROGRAMMING

svcproc.title: PROGRAMMING
svcproc.para: Coolant level monitoring is a customer programmable feature that may be programmed by the Electronic Service Tool using the customer password. Coolant level feature is operational if programmed for three way warning or three way shutdown, however, if not preprogrammed for three way shut down at the factory it will not be possible to enable the shutdown feature. Contact Tech Central or your Navistar dealer for programming this feature.

Flash Code 236 will be active when the ECM detects an in-range voltage error in the ECL circuit. The probable cause for this condition will be a high resistance connection or intermittent short to ground in the circuit.

Flash Code 323 will be active when a low coolant situation is present and the EST will indicate COOLANT LOW. After the coolant has been restored to proper levels, Flash code 323 will remain as an inactive code and the ECM will log the engine hours and odometer reading at time of the occurrence.
